Pretty fun game. Really takes the plot of the original portal and pushes in a good direction. One of the few sequels that I can say can even be better than the original.
Even though I only played the game this year and I'm relatively new to gaming I would 100% recommend this to anyone, it is amazing.
Portal 2 is one of the best Puzzle games of the last century. The story never gets old and the humor is very good.

Gameplay - 10/10
The puzzles are fun and can get quite challenging at times, which only makes them more fun. They are always new, apart from the first few that are the same to the first few Portal 1 levels, but that is on purpose and the levels have had quite a big visual change.

Story - 10/10
The story is very good and the characters are funny (specifically Wheatley, who is voiced by Stephen Merchant). The story has a nice twist in the middle and some comedic humour added in at the correct times. The levels and puzzles are twisted nicely into the story and actually have relevance. 

Co-op - 7/10
The co-op experience is good and its the only game that me and my friend like consistently playing (at the time of writing).

Performance - 10/10
I could probably run this on a Microsoft Surface Tablet thing as my friend ran it on his 'craptop' as a consistent 20-30fps on low settings. But, I dunno what i expected tbh as its from 2011.

Graphics - 8/10
Not quite on par with games like Horizon Zero Dawn or Red Dead Redemption 2... obviously, bcoz its from 2011. But if Valve Release Portal 3 with these graphics today, i would be happy.

Overall, I recommend this game to anyone who hasn't played it yet.
Probably the best puzzle game i've played. Not only is the story great, the multiplayer is also extremly fun to play with friends.
Um otimo game para quem gosta de pensar um pouquinho em vez de esfregar as teclas

Portal 2 continues and enriches deeply the story of Portal, especially the ending is amazing. In addition, the co-operative mode is extremely challenging and very fun to play with friends. I would highly recommended it even if the game had only the co-op mode.
Yes good old game but good game only if portal 1 already but get now good fun experience for playing. SCI - FI Also get Rocket League
hell yes you should play this game. The puzzles are 10x harder this go around but it is so satisfying when you figure them out. Play it.

This is simply a great game. Even thought i completed half of the game while using sv_cheats 1 and noclip because i didn't felt like wasting whole day on most test chambers. Easily the best part of the game was chapter where [spoiler] You explored part of Aperture Science facility, that was sealed and abandoned since many, many years ago. [/spoiler] Ending is simple yet very beautiful. Buy it if you want to both explore amazing and climatic facility of Aperture Science, complete sometimes challenging puzzles, and experience great story. If you are not sure, wait for next big steam sale, like summer, winter, or halloween one.

The sequel to the Biggest and Greatest Game of I-Spy in a generation.At least, that's what I felt like while playing this. Or, that this was that game of I Spy. I really felt like I was playing something revolutionary with Portal 1. Portal 2 feels almost like an expansion that continue the story, which is gripping and exciting, while tossing as many new mechanics and upgrades under the hood as possible. Basic fluid mechanics? Yeah, sure. No fluid weight or pressure games. But there is painting, with different fluids doing different things. There's also tractor / repulsor beams. And I suppose that when modding is taken into consideration, options go well through the roof of original portal.Now, what do we have to say for the game itself?It's more Portal. It took me awhile to sit down and commit to a full playthrough, which wasn't very long. And, honestly, wasn't very challenging. There were some stumpers in there, but only two or three. Maybe four, but I refuse to count the 'paint your own escape' puzzle as one. As most of the challenge was physically painting.The environments though, once you escape the test chambers, are pretty crazy. Also, there are a couple of opportunities to actually break out of the test chambers, in little spaces. Which I think is really cool. Maybe I found the only ones? I hope there are more.I don't know if I would have viewed the game so highly, if I had bought it for $60 on release day. But, on sale when I did buy it, for cheap, years later? You know, I think it was a lot of fun.Not a hardcore puzzle game by any means. But, that's what the workshop is for.
